descriptionHtml:
You MUST have the latest version of Skyrim, Dawnguard, Hearthfire, and Dragonborn in order for this mod to work!!
 
This is a small cottage located next to the road in-between Whiterun and Riverwood. The house is on the cliff with an amazing view of Whiterun.
The main house has a kitchen, master bedroom, child bedroom, and library. The basement in the main house has an armory, storage area, smithing, alchemy, and enchanting area. There is a farm outside that has planting spots like those found in Hearthfire homes, and a spa area. There is a guest house that you can
comfortably leave 3 followers in.
 
This mod is compatible with the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29249/?]Hearthfire Multiple Adoptions[/url] by TMPhoenix. You can up to 2children in this mod. I highly recommend it.
I've also used a lot of custom static meshes so if there's something that you cannot pick up, that's likely why. I know that it's weird to have some things static and some things not, but I personally don't mind it. I assume that the only mods that are non-compatible are mods that modify the cells the house is located in.
 
[size=5][b]Features[/b][/size]
 
83 Containers (ALL Safe)
42 Weapon Racks
6 Shield Racks
9 Mannequins
8 Bookshelves
4 Small Weapon Displays
1 Large Weapon Display
6 Beds (1 Master Bed, 2 Child beds, 3 Follower beds)
Cooking Pot
Oven
Butter Churn
Anvil
Sharpening Wheel
Tanning Rack
Workbench
Alchemy Table
Enchanting Table
Shrine of Dibella, Talos, Mara, Stendarr, and Julianos
2 Chickens, with nests
Apiary
7 Plantable Soil Spots
Guard Dog, Thor (follower)
TONS of Idle Markers for Family and Followers
 
[b]NOTE:[/b] I have a lot of various graphics mods in my game,so the mod might look a little different if you have different graphic mods than I do. Also, in the photos I realized a little late that I have weapons, armor, books, and quest items on display that are not in the actual mod. All of the bookshelves, weapon racks, and mannequins are empty.
 
[b]Resources Used:[/b]
 
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16525/?]ModdersResource Pack[/url] by Oaritys and Tony67
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14133/?]FoodContainer Resource[/url] by Blary
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14135/?]BookSets Resource[/url] byBlary
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30602/?]IngredientsWall Art[/url] by Blary
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14136/?]PotionShelfResource[/url] by Blary
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42362/?]OpenBooks Library[/url] by stoverjm
 
[b]Install[/b]:
 
I really recommend using NMM to install the mod.
--or--
Extract the files into your Data folder.

UPDATE 5/23/15: I wanted to thank those who downloaded, endorsed, and gave feedback! It means a lot to me! I looked at the bugs you guys listed and I'll be working on fixing them. As a temporary fix for the Openbooks Library textures missing, installing the Openbooks mod into your Data folder seems to fix it.

UPDATE 6/25/15: I recently had my hard drive crash on me, and I had lost everything on my computer, including my mod files. It'll take longer than I thought to fix and unfortunately now I have to redue everything. I'm sorry for those waiting for an update.

UPATE 11/10/16: I want to say thank you to all the support that you guys have given this mod! Unfortunately I'm not going to be updating the mod on this version of Skyrim. I do however, plan to update and upload it for the Special Edition when I have time to do so.
author: Hedgina
